headline: Warren Buffett Takes Veiled Dig At Elon Musk While Criticizing CEO Pay Spiral: 'Envy And Greed Walk Hand In Hand'
summary: In his final annual letter as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway Inc (NYSE:BRK) (NYSE:BRK), Warren Buffett has highlighted a concerning trend of escalating CEO compensation amid Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk‘s revised pay. Buffett Criticizes CEO Pay Spiral Buffett pointed out the growing trend of CEOs increasing their own pay after witnessing their peers’ remuneration. The 95-year-old billionaire, who has been at the helm of Berkshire Hathaway for six decades, suggested that CEOs are driven by envy a

headline: Heard on the Street Wednesday Recap: Dow 48000
summary: The House looked set to approve a spending package to reopen the government. The package extends federal funding through Jan. 30 and includes full-year funds for the Agriculture Department, military construction, and the legislative branch.

content.summary: The House looked set to approve a spending package to reopen the government. The package extends federal funding through Jan. 30 and includes full-year funds for the Agriculture Department, military construction, and the legislative branch.

headline: Latest News In Energy Transition - China's Renewable Energy Surge Driven By Government and Technology
summary: The China Renewable Energy Market is poised for significant growth, expected to reach 5.98 GW by 2033 from 2.03 GW in 2024, driven by ambitious carbon neutrality goals and a suite of supportive government policies. This expansion is underpinned by declining costs of solar and wind technologies, advancements in grid infrastructure, and increased adoption of clean energy solutions amidst rising electricity demands due to urbanization and industrialization. The Chinese government's legislative...

headline: Elon Musk's xAI raises $15 billion in latest funding round, CNBC reports
summary: Following CNBC's September report, Musk said the ⁠company was not ‌raising any capital.  XAI, in what seemed like an automated reply, said "Legacy ‍Media Lies" in response to a Reuters request for comment on Thursday's raise.  Investor enthusiasm in artificial intelligence ⁠firms has remained strong even ​as fears of an AI bubble ​emerge due to sky high valuations and massive spending plans.

headline: Tradr Launches Leveraged ETFs on Bloom Energy, Celestica, NANO Nuclear & Synopsys
summary: Tradr ETFs, a provider of ETFs designed for sophisticated investors and professional traders, today launched four new single stock leveraged ETFs. The funds seek to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of a specific underlying stock. Listed on Cboe, these ETFs are the first and only strategies available for this group of growth-oriented companies.

content.title: Tradr Launches Leveraged ETFs on Bloom Energy, Celestica, NANO Nuclear & Synopsys
content.summary: Tradr ETFs, a provider of ETFs designed for sophisticated investors and professional traders, today launched four new single stock leveraged ETFs. The funds seek to deliver twice (200%) the daily performance of a specific underlying stock. Listed on Cboe, these ETFs are the first and only strategies available for this group of growth-oriented companies.

headline: Jewelry Mogul Kendra Scott Built A $1 Billion Brand From $500 And A Baby In A Carrier — 'Failure Wasn't An Option,' She Said
summary: Kendra Scott built a billion-dollar jewelry company from a bedroom with $500 and her newborn son in a carrier by her side. While she was pregnant, she began wiring stones by hand and realized the market didn't offer much between luxury pieces and cheap costume jewelry. "Extra bedroom in my house, on a card table. 500 bucks, baby. That's it," she told James Dumoulin, host of "The School of Hard Knocks" podcast. Scott officially launched Kendra Scott LLC in 2002 despite having no retail background

content.title: Jewelry Mogul Kendra Scott Built A $1 Billion Brand From $500 And A Baby In A Carrier — 'Failure Wasn't An Option,' She Said
content.summary: Kendra Scott built a billion-dollar jewelry company from a bedroom with $500 and her newborn son in a carrier by her side. While she was pregnant, she began wiring stones by hand and realized the market didn't offer much between luxury pieces and cheap costume jewelry. "Extra bedroom in my house, on a card table. 500 bucks, baby. That's it," she told James Dumoulin, host of "The School of Hard Knocks" podcast. Scott officially launched Kendra Scott LLC in 2002 despite having no retail background

headline: Tesla Is Working to Add Apple CarPlay in Bid to Boost Vehicle Sales
summary: The CarPlay platform — long supported by other automakers — shows users a version of the iPhone’s software that’s optimized for vehicle infotainment systems.  Adding CarPlay would mark a stunning reversal for Tesla and Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, who long ignored pleas to implement the popular feature.  Musk has criticized Apple for years, particularly its App Store policies, and was angered by the company’s poaching of his engineers when it set out to build its own car.

content.title: Tesla Is Working to Add Apple CarPlay in Bid to Boost Vehicle Sales
content.summary: The CarPlay platform — long supported by other automakers — shows users a version of the iPhone’s software that’s optimized for vehicle infotainment systems.  Adding CarPlay would mark a stunning reversal for Tesla and Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, who long ignored pleas to implement the popular feature.  Musk has criticized Apple for years, particularly its App Store policies, and was angered by the company’s poaching of his engineers when it set out to build its own car.

headline: Elon Musk says report on xAI's $15 billion fundraise is 'false'
summary: The latest CNBC report said the capital ‌raise added another $5 billion to the $10 billion round that valued xAI at $200 billion.  XAI, in what seemed like an automated reply, said "Legacy Media ‍Lies" in response to a Reuters request for comment on the latest fundraise.

content.title: Elon Musk says report on xAI's $15 billion fundraise is 'false'
content.summary: The latest CNBC report said the capital ‌raise added another $5 billion to the $10 billion round that valued xAI at $200 billion.  XAI, in what seemed like an automated reply, said "Legacy Media ‍Lies" in response to a Reuters request for comment on the latest fundraise.
